intro: Hieracium oskordalicum, commonly known as the Oskorodalic hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and rocky areas, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are generally lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a disc-like structure. Hieracium oskordalicum is often found in open habitats and is relatively hardy, tolerating a range of soil conditions.
